section.title: Configuration
section.para: The NakedObjectConfiguration interface provides the rest of the framework with a central place to access all configuration properties. Each property is accessed by a fully qualified name and type.
A configuration is installed by assigning an instance of org.nakedobjects.utility.NakedObjectConfiguration to the NOF repository. How the properties are loaded is then up to the implementation.
The configuration component can be retrieved from org.nakedobjects.NakedObjects using the getConfiguration method.

The configuration allows you to add properties to it, check it contains a specific property and get specific properties by name. The get methods return specific type such as boolean, integer, font, color and strings.

All of the configuration options can be set programmatically, which can be convienient when developing and running the exploration code, avoiding the need to create a separate configuration file.
